data.title: Fraternity & Sorority Affairs
data.text:
Key

Council

BGC: Black Greek Council

IFC: Interfraternity Council

UGC: United Greek Council

Affiliations

Many of our fraternal organizations are affiliated with academics, culture and religious institutions. However, theses fraternities are not exclusively for those who identify with these particular affiliations. Students who are interested in a particular culture and religion may also seek membership into these organizations. Students interested in seeking membership into an organization with an academic affiliation should consult with the chapter in case membership is limited to those within particular majors.

Chapter House/Facility

Certified: Denotes a property that is owned/leased by a House Corporation that has chosen to participate in the Private Certified Housing program and must comply with the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign standards for certification.

Non-Certified: Property is owned/leased by a House Corporation but does not participate in the Private Certified Housing program.

Non-Residential: Property is owned and/or operated by a House Corporation and is used for chapter functions and meetings however the facility does not house residents.

Learn more about the Private Certified Housing designation.

* Denotes alcohol-free housing per inter/national standards.

New or Returning Organization to Illinois

These organizations are currently starting a brand new chapter or restarting a former dormant/unrecognized chapter at Illinois. Fraternity & Sorority Affairs staff are working closely with the national board/headquarters and/or designated representative. The office facilitates a connection with campus and provides initial resources until such time the chapter has initiated members and is able to become a Registered Student Organization and officially joins one of the four governing councils.

^ Denotes a new or returning organization to Illinois.
